channel.title: CNN.com - Health
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Health
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Retired teacher loses 200 pounds
item.description: "There's another one who will break our equipment," Kathleen Riser overheard one trainer say, pointing at her 350-plus pound frame. Two years later, people now point to Riser as an inspiration.

item.title: 'Big Ben' loses 145 pounds
item.description: After almost two years of strict dieting and exercise Ben's 140lbs lighter. He's lost 38 inches off of his waist and tossed out his 3XL shirts to make room for his new size, large.

item.title: Plant-based diet is his secret
item.description: For years Benji Kurtz was severely obese. He tried diet after diet. Then the solution to his weight loss problem found him.

item.title: Break up with your trainer
item.description: After months of personal training, you're still not seeing results. Could it be time to ditch your trainer?

item.title: 9 nutrition rules for athletes
item.description: Follow these nutrition guidelines to ensure your hard work in training pays off.

item.title: 21 pounds of flesh removed
item.description: I am a CNN Fit Nation alumna. I completed the Nautica Malibu Triathlon in 2013 with my Fit Nation teammates. But my journey to health really started more than two years ago.

item.title: Venom may hold cure for cancer
item.description: How nanotechnology and synthesized venom may hold the key to stopping cancer cell growth.

item.title: Eating out costs you 200 calories
item.description: Skipping the drive-thru for a sit-down meal at a restaurant won't allow you to skip the extra calories, a new study suggests.

item.title: Get 'em now! 8 summer foods
item.description: Farmers markets are brimming with beautiful, ripe produce for the picking, local foods are flooding the supermarket, and it's finally time for juicy berries and stone fruits to take center stage.

item.title: Do's and don'ts for summertime sex
item.description: The weather doesn't have to be the only thing heating up this month. Summer is an excellent time to recharge and rejuvenate -- and your love life should be no exception.

item.title: 5 mosquito bite myths
item.description: The colors you wear and the food you eat don't matter. We bust five common mosquito bite myths to help you stop the itch.

item.title: The best way to brush
item.description: CNN's Martha Shade reports on what's the best way to brush your teeth.

item.title: Still smoking after cancer
item.description: CNN's Holly Firfer tells us that some people who have beat cancer continue to smoke.

item.title: How outbreak can start, and end
item.description: Dr. Sanjay Gupta describes how "contact tracing" could help stem the tide of an Ebola outbreak.

item.title: The healthiest fish to eat?
item.description: As our oceans become more polluted, Sally Kohn sits down with Fabien Cousteau to talk about the healthiest fish to eat.

item.title: Plastic surgery gone wrong
item.description: Dr. Terry Dubrow and Dr. Paul Nassif from E!'s new show "Botched" discuss the risks and complications of plastic surgery.

item.title: Ha! Laughter is the best medicine
item.description: Scott Weems, author of "Ha! The Science of When we Laugh and Why," speaks with CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta.

item.title: Sleep more, lose weight
item.description: Dr. Sanjay Gupta tells us how sleeping more can actually help you feel less hungry.

item.title: Say 'Hello.' You'll live longer
item.description: Dr. Sanjay Gupta tells us how something as simple, and as nice, as saying "hello" can help you live to 100.

item.title: String may help you live to 100
item.description: Dr. Sanjay Gupta tells us how flossing regularly not only helps prevent heart disease but can also help you live to 100.

item.title: Twin boys born 24 days apart
item.description: Due to a delayed delivery, a set of twins in Massachusetts were born 24 days apart. WCVB's Mary Saladna reports.

item.title: Is red meat really bad for you?
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta talks with Nina Teicholz, author of "The Big Fat Surprise."

item.title: This is your body on weed
item.description: Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains how marijuana affects the brain and how pot can be used to treat certain conditions.

item.title: See man after 700-lb. loss
item.description: Robert Walls tipped the scales at 950 lbs. before he made a big decision that helped him shed hundreds of pounds.

item.title: Teacher eats only McDonald's
item.description: A teacher only eats McDonald's for 90 days, and LOSES 37 pounds. KCCI reports.

item.title: Selfies leading to head lice
item.description: Nurses report "selfie" posts are causing an increase in teenagers spreading lice.

item.title: World's most dangerous workout?
item.description: Is the "sport of fitness" the world's most dangerous workout? CNN's Jarrett Bellini asks CrossFitters and gives it a go.

item.title: Hear Mrs. O rap for healthy foods
item.description: First lady Michelle Obama raps about food at an event to propose limits on the types of foods advertised in schools.

item.title: Brain dead: What it is, what it isn't
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains how doctors determine if a patient is brain dead.

item.title: Hypnosis helped her lose 140 pounds
item.description: A dream vacation to Hawaii sounded like a nightmare to Julie Evans because it involved wearing a bathing suit. So when she got home, she vowed to change.

item.title: Mental health help: Where to turn
item.description: Americans often don't know where to turn when dealing with a loved one with serious mental illness, but experts emphsize there are resources available.

item.title: What if they kill again?
item.description: A program in Maine has shown remarkable progress in the rehabilitation of the state's insane patients, including those who have killed. "We don't have an experience of recidivism," health commissioner says.

item.title: Every day, I struggle to breathe
item.description: Breathe in.

item.title: It's OK to ask about depression
item.description: CNN's Kat Kinsman shares her personal journey of going public with her depression.

item.title: Whiz kids changing medicine
item.description: A 10-year-old inventor and a 20-year-old doctor? Meet the whiz kids changing the face of medicine.

item.title: Embarrassing diseases are a real pain in the...
item.description: There are the diseases you don't want to get because they'll kill you. Then there are the diseases you don't want to get because you are too embarrassed to discuss them out loud, even with your doctor.

item.title: Does oil pulling work?
item.description: Starting the day off at the beach with your skin smelling of tropical-scented sunscreen can be one of life's greatest pleasures. Smelling coconut oil as you swish it around in your mouth before work -- well, that's another story.

item.title: One drink. 8 cookies. Same sugar.
Cystic fibrosis doesn't have to define you
item.description: Breathe in.

item.title: Ebola: New restrictions in Kenya
item.description: Kenya Airways will suspend flight operations to Liberia and Sierra Leone, the latest airline to curb flights because of the ongoing Ebola outbreak in West Africa. The suspension is temporary, and the airline will continue operating flights to Nigeria and Ghana, Kenya Airways said.

item.title: 'Ice Bucket Challenge' fundraiser dies
item.description: A friend of the man who inspired the viral "Ice Bucket Challenge" died this weekend in a diving accident.

item.title: Antibiotics may mess with your baby's metabolism
item.description: Here's a roundup of five medical studies published this week that might give you new insights into your health, mind and body. Remember, correlation is not causation -- so if a study finds a connection between two things, it doesn't mean that one causes the other.

item.title: Robin Williams had Parkinson's
item.description: Robin Williams was in the early stages of Parkinson's disease when he died this week, his wife says.

item.title: CDC: Scientist to blame for deadly flu incident
item.description: A lab mix-up involving a deadly flu virus strain added to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's public relations nightmare this summer.

item.title: Avoid the 'back-to-school plague'
item.description: Kids get eight to 12 colds or cases of the flu each year. But there are simple ways to keep them healthy.

item.title: Where's my orgasm?
item.description: According to studies, 43% of women have experienced some form of sexual dysfunction. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Sugar substitutes 101
item.description: This next generation seems way more wholesome than its chem-lab predecessors. But are these sugar subs better for you?

item.title: 10 yoga poses to beat stress
item.description: Don't let stress get the best of you! Start your day off right with this yoga sequence for beginners. These 10 yoga poses will have you feeling refreshed in no time.

item.title: You NEED the corner office
item.description: Exposure to daylight improves workers mood, communication abilities, effectiveness on the job, sleep, and overall health.

item.title: Could blood test predict suicides?
item.description: Approximately 36,000 deaths are caused by suicide each year in the United States. What if a simple blood test could one day help prevent that from happening?

item.title: Spanking's effect on kids' brains
item.description: Researchers say physical punishment actually alters the brain -- not only in an "I'm traumatized!" kind of way, but also in an "I literally have less gray matter in my brain!" kind of way.
